rundown: 1-5 L vs Los Angeles Angels Bryce Elder: 5.0 innings, 4 earned runs, 8 hits, 2 HR, 5 strikeouts Batters: Jurickson Profar (1 hits - 3 AB, 1 HR, 1 RBI) The Braves fell to the Los Angeles Angels with a final score of 1-5. The loss was primarily due to a rough outing from starting pitcher Bryce Elder, who allowed 4 earned runs over 5 innings. The Braves struggled to capitalize on their opportunities, managing only 1 run despite 5 hits. Key highlights from the game include: 1. Jurickson Profar hit a solo home run, providing the Braves' only run of the game. 2. The Angels' offense was strong, racking up 11 hits and scoring 5 runs. 3. Bryce Elder struck out 5 batters but was hurt by giving up 2 home runs.
